item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, November 7, 2024 at 1:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Passport Photos (404 points | 58 comments)
2. Trudeau government bans TikTok from operating in Canada (249 points | 147 comments)
3. Guy gives a negative review to Battlezone after playing 8k hours; He's right (68 points | 18 comments)
4. Don't return named tuples in new APIs (17 points | 6 comments)
5. 131M American Buildings (81 points | 18 comments)
6. Private Cloud Compute Security Guide (277 points | 122 comments)
7. Show HN: Hacker News frontpage as a print newspaper that you can personalize (246 points | 71 comments)
8. Visualizing binary files with ImHex's DSL, the "pattern language" (24 points | 3 comments)
9. One year, 41M digits: How Luke Durant found the largest known prime number (21 points | 6 comments)
10. New images of Jupiter (418 points | 68 comments)
11. Show HN: SuperSplat – open-source 3D Gaussian Splat Editor (190 points | 44 comments)
12. Launch HN: Midship (YC S24) – Turn PDFs, docs, and images into usable data (50 points | 31 comments)
13. Show HN: Aide, an open-source AI native IDE (128 points | 106 comments)
14. Physicists spot quantum tornadoes twirling in a 'supersolid' (41 points | discuss)
15. Monorepo – Our Experience (120 points | 125 comments)
16. Exposure to phthalate compromises brain function in adult vertebrates (76 points | 15 comments)
17. Hacking cars in JavaScript (Replay attacks in the browser with the HackRF) (38 points | 1 comment)
18. The deep learning boom caught almost everyone by surprise (213 points | 142 comments)
19. Model Predictive Control in the Browser with WebAssembly (90 points | 12 comments)
20. 98.css – A design system for building faithful recreations of old UIs (379 points | 78 comments)
21. Forget CDK and AWS's insane costs. Pulumi and DigitalOcean to the rescue (77 points | 41 comments)
22. Trump wins presidency for second time (1597 points | 7509 comments)
23. Sysadmin shock as Windows Server 2025 installs itself after labeling error (29 points | 6 comments)
24. Caring for yourself while caring for others (230 points | 39 comments)
25. WebSockets cost us $1M on our AWS bill (229 points | 146 comments)
26. Show HN: Term-Lisp – A Lisp, based on pattern matching and term rewriting (51 points | 19 comments)
27. Kernel optimization with BOLT (binary optimization and layout tool) (133 points | 17 comments)
28. The decline of the working musician (90 points | 84 comments)
29. Switch 2 will be backwards compatible with Switch (261 points | 167 comments)
30. Learning not to trust the All-In podcast (300 points | 145 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, November 7, 2024 at 1:10 AM UTC
